result.execSummary:
The defendant Codi James Walztoni was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Codi James Walztoni is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Codi James Walztoni was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 11:30 Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for Defendant Codi James Walztoni. Prosecuting Atty Sean Edward Froelich appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Codi James Walztoni appeared by phone means with the permission of the court, defendant in CA. Froelich: plead guilty to count 1--sentence of time served, count 2 dismiss, count 3 dismiss.  Parties agree. Defendant waives right to appear in person and wishes to go forward with plea.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is reviewed with the defendant on the record.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1.   Facts are correct.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Count 1, court orders counts 2 and 3 dismissed. Parties and defendant address the court. Court orders on count 1: time served. Atty Nelson will send defendant appeal rights, defendant is to fill out and send back. 11:40

Pre-trial conference on June 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
for a continuance on the pre trial. re: Defendant in a treatment program, filed by Atty Nelson. No objection from Atty Froelich.

04:08 Defendant Codi James Walztoni in court, in custody  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ. Liesl Nelson appears via phone. Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has copy of complaint.   Court reads charges and possible penalties.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Defendant pleads not guilty to all 3 counts. Court rec/enters.  Froelich:  recommends $2000 signature bond.  Court orders $2000 singature bond.  Defendant has not been in the armed services. 4:15  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
